eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Migration Alliance at Yale (MAY)
eventData.description:
The Migration Alliance at Yale is a group of undergraduate students passionately devoted to aiding all migrants - including refugees, documented & undocumented immigrants, and asylum seekers - in Greater New Haven. MAY is an umbrella organization that consists of several constituent groups, each of which take on distinct roles in serving the migrant population in our city. We organize youth groups, advise young people through college applications and job searches, provide legal assistance, and lead advocacy. The challenges of migration are numerous, and vary from family to family. For years, MAY volunteers have been responding to these challenges and have helped provide community members with critical support.

Come say hello to our board and learn more about MAY's work. We can't wait to meet you!

eventData.headline: Yale Alley Cats
eventData.description:
Yale Alley Cats - An Undergraduate A Cappella Singing Group

World-renowned, world-touring TTBB a cappella group at Yale since 1943. Everybody wants to be a cat! Join us for a Q&A and introduction to the Yale Alley Cats.

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Trans@Yale
eventData.description:
Trans@Yale builds community among and provides emotional support for trans and non-binary students at Yale. We collaborate with groups across Yale and New Haven, share tips and knowledge on being trans+ at Yale, and work with the Yale administration to provide respect and support, individually and institutionally, for trans and non-binary students.

Come meet and hang out with current trans and non-binary students and fellow pre-frosh!

Meeting ID: 879 3277 3080
Passcode: bulldogs

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale Undergrad Research Association
eventData.description:
YURA is the foremost student group working to support undergraduate researchers at Yale, and collaborates with faculty, administration, and alum to increase accessibility of research opportunities at Yale and improve the undergraduate research experience.

A presentation of YURA initiatives that support undergraduate researchers (include the biannual symposiums, Yale Undergraduate Research Journal, and the Graduate-Undergraduate Mentorship Initiative), as well as a panel discussion of the Yale undergraduate research experience. Prospective students will get a sneak peek into the resources Yale and YURA provide undergraduates, talk to Yalie researchers about their experience with the world-class research opportunities available at Yale, and get tips on how to get involved in the world-class research experiences available at Yale.

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Slifka Center for Jewish Life
eventData.description:
The Joseph Slifka Center for Jewish Life at Yale aims to connect Yale students to Judaism in deeply meaningful and personal ways that empower them to improve Yale, the Jewish community, and the world at large. We do this by:
- Engaging students as participants in, and leaders of, a vibrant, creative, and diverse Jewish community where Shabbat, holidays, Torah study, social justice work, engagement with Israel, and other experiences are inspiring moments of Jewish growth.
- Supporting students with resources they need to thrive in college including caring adults, opportunities for friendship and community, and spaces to eat and study that feel like a home-away-from-home
- Maintaining robust infrastructure that supports compelling Jewish experiences on and around the Yale campus that also welcomes and educates the entire student body
- Participating in urgent contemporary conversations by bringing the full intellectual resources of Yale into dialogue with Jewish thought, history, and values.
 
When Slifka Center succeeds, it profoundly influences students’ identities and priorities, setting them on a path to make courageously creative contributions to the Jewish community and the world at large.

At this "Slifka Meet and Greet," prefrosh will first hear from a diverse panel of students about how they have found a meaningful Jewish community at Yale. After this panel, prefrosh will be sorted into breakout rooms headed by members of the panel so that they can get to know each other and pose questions in a more intimate setting.

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Glee Club
eventData.description: Meet and talk with members of the Yale Glee Club! We are Yale’s principal undergraduate mixed choir and oldest musical organization, currently in our 160th season. We sing many different kinds of music, including contemporary choral music, spirituals & folk songs, world music, big choral pieces with orchestra, and of course, traditional Yale songs. In this session, we will be listening to some past recordings and answering any questions you may have about the audition process, what it's like to be in YGC, our favorite Glee memories, and more! https://gleeclub.yalecollege.yale.edu/

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale Fishing Club
eventData.description:
Since 1948 Yale’s Fishing Club has brought student-anglers together. The club sponsors chartered fishing trips, small group trips, competitions, and workshops on fishing techniques, fly-tying, and fly-casting. Our club is open to any current Yale undergraduate or graduate students; however, faculty, staff and alumni may purchase a permit to fish the Edward C. Migdalski Pond at the Yale Outdoor Education Center in East Lyme, CT. The club is active throughout the year.

Meet with members for a brief overview of the club activities, history and benefits of membership.

eventData.headline: Splash at Yale
eventData.description:
Splash at Yale is an event that brings high school and middle school students to Yale University for one day of unlimited learning. Students who come take class in a variety of both conventional and unconventional subjects taught by Yale undergraduate and graduate students! [Due to the ongoing pandemic, we will be hosting an online program this spring.]

Learn about our awesome organization and meet some of our current admins!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: First Years in Support of New Haven
eventData.description:
First-Years in Support of New Haven is an academic-year program for Yale College first-years to sustainably connect and consciously engage with the vibrant New Haven community. Our aim is to learn from the leadership and experience of community partners who dedicate their professional and personal lives to our shared city. We strive to foster open conversations about the changing New Haven/Yale relationship and engage in sustainable service that will continue throughout each student's time in New Haven.

Welcome to Yale! FIS-NH is hosting an event to get to know you, introduce you to New Haven, and have all your Yale questions answered. Hope to see you then!
